actor_awards.notes: Best known for her iconic portrayal of the Wicked Witch of the West in The Wizard of Oz. She was a former kindergarten teacher who became one of Hollywood's most recognizable character actresses. She received a Special Award from the Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy & Horror Films in 1979.

filmography.title: The Wizard of Oz
filmography.role: Miss Gulch / The Wicked Witch of the West
filmography.role_description: The mean-spirited neighbor who tries to take Toto, and her terrifying Oz counterpart who seeks the ruby slippers.
filmography.plot: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home.

filmography.title: The Ox-Bow Incident
filmography.role_description: The stern, unyielding housekeeper of the Judge who gets involved in the mob justice mentality.
filmography.plot: When a posse captures three men suspected of killing a local farmer, they become strongly divided over whether or not to lynch the men.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Film

filmography.title: My Little Chickadee
filmography.role_description: A gossiping, judgmental town busybody who disapproves of Flower Belle Lee.
filmography.plot: A sultry singer with a bad reputation meets a con man on a train and they enter a sham marriage to fool a town.

filmography.title: State of the Union
filmography.role_description: The loyal, opinionated maid of the prospective presidential candidate.
filmography.plot: An industrialist is urged to run for President, but requires the support of his estranged wife to appear as a happy family man.

filmography.title: You Only Live Once
filmography.role_description: The landlady of the boarding house where the doomed couple stays.
filmography.plot: An ex-convict tries to go straight, but society and circumstances force him back into a life of crime.

filmography.title: Nothing Sacred
filmography.role_description: A small but memorable role as a skeptical woman in a Vermont town.
filmography.plot: A reporter tries to redeem his reputation by exploiting the story of a Vermont woman who thinks she is dying of radium poisoning.

filmography.title: Babes in Arms
filmography.role_description: A severe judge of the juvenile court who opposes the children putting on a show.
filmography.plot: A group of talented teenagers put on a show to prove to their vaudevillian parents that they don't need to be sent to work farms.

filmography.title: 13 Ghosts
filmography.role_description: The eerie, stern housekeeper who knows the secrets of the haunted house.
filmography.plot: A family inherits a house that comes with a special pair of goggles that allows them to see the twelve ghosts inhabiting the place.

filmography.title: The Anderson Tapes
filmography.role_description: One of the residents of the apartment building targeted for a sophisticated heist.
filmography.plot: A career criminal plans a massive robbery of an entire luxury apartment block, unaware that he is under surveillance.

filmography.title: Brewster McCloud
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, bird-hating socialite who sings the national anthem in a memorable scene.
filmography.plot: A young man living in the Houston Astrodome creates a pair of wings in his attempt to fly.

filmography.title: These Three
filmography.role_description: The maid in the household where a malicious lie destroys the lives of two teachers.
filmography.plot: Two schoolteachers are accused of a lesbian relationship by a malicious student, based on the play 'The Children's Hour'.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Bonita Granville)

filmography.title: People Will Talk
filmography.role_description: The bitter housekeeper who holds a secret regarding the doctor's past.
filmography.plot: A physician is accused of malpractice by a jealous colleague and falls in love with a patient who becomes pregnant by another man.
filmography.awards: Writers Guild Award: Nomination – Best Written American Comedy

filmography.title: A Slight Case of Murder
filmography.role_description: The wife of a beer baron who struggles with their transition to legitimacy after Prohibition.
filmography.plot: A bootlegger goes legitimate after the repeal of Prohibition but faces financial trouble and four dead bodies in his house.

filmography.title: Guest in the House
filmography.role_description: The housekeeper who witnesses the disruptive influence of a manipulative young woman on a happy family.
filmography.plot: A mentally unstable young woman moves into her doctor's home and begins to manipulate his family.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
filmography.role_description: A townsperson and mother of Tom's friend Joe Harper in this Technicolor adaptation.
filmography.plot: Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn witness a murder and have various adventures in their Mississippi River town.

filmography.title: The Sin of Harold Diddlebock
filmography.role_description: The youngest of the spinster sisters who Harold Diddlebock proposes to.
filmography.plot: After being fired from his dull job, a former football hero goes on a drinking binge and wakes up owning a circus.

filmography.title: The Red Pony
filmography.role_description: The schoolteacher of the young boy in this adaptation of John Steinbeck's story.
filmography.plot: A young boy is given a red pony by his father, and learns important life lessons through raising it.

filmography.title: Saratoga
filmography.role_description: A supporting character in Jean Harlow's final film.
filmography.plot: A bookie and the daughter of a horse breeder clash and fall in love at the races.

filmography.title: Four's a Crowd
filmography.role_description: The housekeeper for a wealthy tycoon who gets involved in the romantic farce.
filmography.plot: A public relations man tries to fix the image of a hated millionaire while juggling three different women.

filmography.title: The Invisible Woman
filmography.role_description: The housekeeper who is baffled by the antics of the invisible model.
filmography.plot: A scientist invents an invisibility machine and uses a model as his subject, leading to comedic chaos.

filmography.title: Johnny Come Lately
filmography.role_description: The sister of the corrupt town boss in this James Cagney vehicle.
filmography.plot: A vagrant journalist helps an elderly newspaper editor fight local corruption in a small town.

filmography.title: Dishonored Lady
filmography.role_description: The landlady of the protagonist who is accused of murder.
filmography.plot: A fashion editor with a scandalous past is accused of killing her former lover.

filmography.title: Wabash Avenue
filmography.role_description: A temperance advocate who disapproves of the nightlife scene.
filmography.plot: Two men vie for the affections of a shimmy dancer in 1890s Chicago.

filmography.title: Rosie!
filmography.role_description: The housekeeper and companion to the eccentric, wealthy title character.
filmography.plot: A wealthy widow's daughters try to have her declared incompetent to get her money, but she fights back.

filmography.title: The Daydreamer
filmography.role_description: The mean landlady in the live-action segments of this Hans Christian Andersen tribute.
filmography.plot: A young Hans Christian Andersen learns life lessons from the characters in the stories he will one day write.
